item.title: What is easiear Java or C++?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

The fact that VS for C# is the best IDE ever doesn’t mean that you can’t use other IDEs for C#. If by officially supported you mean supported by Microsoft, that doesn’t change anything. Most languages are not officially supported by the OS developer(s), yet they are widely used. The C# language might have been created by Microsoft, but it is an (official) international standard (ECMA-334) and can hence be implemented by anyone who so wishes. Java™, however, is no standard at all, and it belongs to the Sun Microsystems enterprise, which happens to have the same purpose as Microsoft and every other enterprise, (make money). In fact, the Java™ name itself is a trademark (hence the usual tm) and you can hardly even use it without being sued by them.

Read full topic
item.source: What is easiear Java or C++?
